availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: F. Rolly W. Chapman (Adair County, Kentucky, carpenter and Second Lieutenant (U.S.A.))

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Rolly Chapman and Priscilla Chapman. Married to Sally Chapman. Father of Lucy J. Chapman, Samuel T. Chapman, William Louis Chapman, John Chapman, Kate Chapman, and James Toby Chapman. Laborer in Clinton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Carpenter in Russell County in 1860. Served in the 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain and first lieutenant from April 15, 1863, to December 1863. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and first lieutenant from December 23, 1863 to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 360.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 305, 913.
Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, 1773-2007, U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, Series Number T288
